text: I love communication and travelling! I believe every person and every place has a story to tell, and I'm always eager to read them — preferably over tea.
Weekends? Oh, a mix of wandering around new places and diving into LLM papers or cool new web frameworks. Balance of legs and logic!
Fun fact: I once spent hours tweaking the color scheme of a portfolio project — not because I had to, but because I just couldn't let lavender win.
I'm currently pursuing my MCA at Jadavpur University (8.33 CGPA), after topping my B.Sc. (Hons.) in Computer Science at WBSU with a CGPA of 9.91. I believe in learning deeply and staying curious.
My academic journey includes ranking 2nd in WB-JECA 2024 and consistently topping my B.Sc. semesters. Learning isn't a phase — it's a lifestyle, and I kinda love the grind.
I'm deeply passionate about machine learning, LLMs, web development, and UI/UX. If I had to sum it up: I like making things smart and beautiful.
I'm fluent in C, C++, Java, SQL, and 8085 Assembly. I enjoy working across the stack with HTML, CSS, JS, React, Next.js, Tailwind, and tools like Supabase, Git, Hugging Face, and Ubuntu.
I'm a sucker for well-designed developer tools — anything that saves a second, reduces friction, or brings delight. Code should be joyful, not just functional.
I love debugging. Solving bugs is like untangling wires — messy, frustrating, but so satisfying when it clicks. Especially when the fix is a one-liner. Chef's kiss.
One project I love is 'Let's Connect!' — an AI-driven platform to automate campus recruitment using LLMs and Streamlit. It boosted outreach speed by 3x and cut down manual effort massively.
I designed a stock prediction model comparing ReLU and GELU activations using LSTM. Built the whole pipeline from scratch — and no, it didn't predict my anime addiction.
Star Emporium was one of my Java GUI projects — a robust e-book library that cut paper use and boosted accessibility. Books, bytes, and a bit of Swing magic!
I enjoy pushing code to GitHub, especially around ML experiments and UI tweaks. Open source feels like digital gardening — you plant ideas and hope others grow them.
My friends often call me the 'team leader' — not just for taking charge or prowess, but for making sure everyone gets a say and feels heard. Leadership isn't about control, it's about connection.
I enjoy leading projects, but I also listen. I've found that the best teams aren't led by volume, but by vision — and maybe the occasional meme.
Personalization via code really drives me. Whether it's designing intuitive UIs or training adaptive models, I love building things that feel tailor-made.
I'm open to fair compensation aligned with role and responsibilities. At this stage, I'm focused on learning, growing, and contributing to meaningful work.
My dream job? Working on AI systems that help real people in real-time. Think open-source LLM tools, clean UI, and loads of learning along the way.
In 5 years, I'd love to see myself building impactful AI tools and mentoring juniors. Ideally with a German Shepherd beside me and an ergonomic chair under me.

You can reach me at avrodeep.pal17@gmail.com or call at +91-8583842681. I'm also on LinkedIn (https://linkedin.com/in/avrodeeppal) and GitHub (https://github.com/AvrodeepPal) if you want to stalk my code — politely, of course!
I'm currently based near Jadavpur, Kolkata (700068). But home will always be Barrackpore (700120), a quieter corner of the city with strong roots.
Still a student! I live on scholarships and optimism (mostly scholarships though). I'm not earning yet — but I'm eager to dive into meaningful work soon.
I believe in fair, market-standard compensation with appreciation for impact. I bring a lot to the table — and maybe even the table itself if needed.
